channel.title: The createclassfile method of the game_unpacker
channel.description:
The game unpacker recreates the class files from the constant table file and the bytecode files (inside runescape.js5(yes i extracted it))
i attached because it was 49kbs (google allowed me to post it in code tags XD)

no thats the rs.pack200

item.title: The createclassfile method of the game_unpacker
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:278380”]If I remember correctly, it is basically a pack200 file with a few bytes stripped off at the beginning, tack those back on and you can use the built in pack200 support to extract it, that is what I did to repackage the .pack200 files to a .jar here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/bin_gl/pack200tojar/
Source code here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/tools/RsPack200ToJar.java

See if it works on that .js5 file.[/quote]
It’s definitely not a normal .pack200 nor a GZIPPED pack200
(I’ve tried both)

Read full topic

item.title: The createclassfile method of the game_unpacker
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If I remember correctly, it is basically a pack200 file with a few bytes stripped off at the beginning, tack those back on and you can use the built in pack200 support to extract it, that is what I did to repackage the .pack200 files to a .jar here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/bin_gl/pack200tojar/
Source code here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/tools/RsPack200ToJar.java

See if it works on that .js5 file.

item.title: The createclassfile method of the game_unpacker
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

It’s not his system. It’s a refactored version of the client’s system.

From JSR-200:

Classes are represented in a form which suppresses their individual constant pools, in favor of a large constant pool that serves the entire archive.

References like the above, sprinkled throughout JSR-200 (The pack200 specification), fit the description in your first post pretty well…

I couldn’t find an open source implementation of unpack200, but a light browse through JSR-200 reveals that you may have refactored a slightly modified version of unpack200. You might be able to locate an open source implementation in something like Apache Harmony if you really feel like you need to see if you wasted your time refactoring “createclassfile”. That being said, I think this is a very nice and thorough effort.

Edit:

This is NOT simply pack200. This is the format of a reference table (the parser calls it ‘JS5’; throw new RuntimeException("Incorrect JS5 protocol number: " + protocolNum); ) where the classes are stored in the pack200-ed format.

Read full topic
item.source: The createclassfile method of the game_unpacker
